intro: Linzia vernonioides, commonly known as the common linzie, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Linzia vernonioides is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
